org.nerd4j.csv.conf.mapping.ann

Annotation Type CSVReader


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface CSVReader
    Creates a CSVReader using the annotated JavaBean to retrieve the required configurations.

    Usage

    The CSVReader annotation can be used with the following program elements:

    • JavaBean class.

    This annotation is equivalent to the XML configuration csv:reader.

    Author:
    Nerd4j Team

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean acceptIncompleteRecords
      In the CSV standard each record must have the same number of cells.
      CSVParser[] parser
      Configures a custom CSVParser for the current CSVReader.
      boolean readHeader
      Tells the CSVReader to read the first row of the CSV source and use it as a CSV header.
      boolean useColumnNames
      Tells the CSVReader to use the read CSV header to link each column to the configured name.

    • Element Detail

      • readHeader

        public abstract boolean readHeader
        Tells the CSVReader to read the first row of the CSV source and use it as a CSV header.
        Returns:
        true if the CSV header has to be read.
        Default:
        true

      • useColumnNames

        public abstract boolean useColumnNames
        Tells the CSVReader to use the read CSV header to link each column to the configured name.

        This parameter can be true only if the 'readHeader' is also true, otherwise the configuration is inconsistent.

        Returns:
        true if the column names has to be used instead of the column indexes.
        Default:
        true

      • acceptIncompleteRecords

        public abstract boolean acceptIncompleteRecords
        In the CSV standard each record must have the same number of cells. But it is possible to face non standard CSV files where records have different lengths.

        This flag tells the CSVReader to accept such non standard files. In this case the reader may return incomplete data models.

        Default:
        false

      • parser

        public abstract CSVParser[] parser
        Configures a custom CSVParser for the current CSVReader.
        Returns:
        custom CSVParser configuration.
        Default:
        {}
